triples.name: Linear temporal logic
triples.relevance: Linear temporal logic is used to specify the formal requirements for the control synthesis algorithm

triples.name: Temporal logic
triples.relevance: The paper builds on temporal logic theory to synthesize motion plans with formal guarantees

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control synthesis is a core theoretical foundation for the proposed algorithm

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses motion planning problems for multi-robot systems under temporal logic constraints

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Multi-robot systems covered by the paper relate to coordinated robotic swarm control problems

triples.name: Graph traversal
triples.relevance: Graph search techniques are the baseline approach that STyLuS* improves upon

triples.name: Büchi automaton
triples.relevance: Büchi automata are used to represent temporal logic specifications in product automata

triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: Model checkers are existing tools that STyLuS* surpasses in handling larger state spaces

triples.name: Monte Carlo method
triples.relevance: Sampling-based algorithms like those in motion planning rely on Monte Carlo principles

triples.name: Optimal control
triples.relevance: STyLuS* extends optimal control synthesis methods to scale to large multi-robot systems with temporal logic specifications
